tweet: Still owns $AMZN $MSFT but notes his portfolio now has least growth tilt of past 6-7 years. And of course caveat he can change his mind in a week or two.

If their underlying businesses were traded separately, how many would you want to buy?  GEICO? BNSF? AAPL? (Buffett views as 3rd biz)  MidAmerican? Precision Castparts? Nebraska Furniture? See’s? etc. Ppl always focus on BV & allocator, how about underlying businesses.
Tepper: “Some of the tech stocks like $AMZN might be not that overvalued; I’m not saying the Nasdaq’s cheap by any stretch… but it’s not 1999.  There’s definitely some misvalued companies out there.”

Fair point on potential culture shift. Even though owned by FB, seems like IG viewed itself & ran product a bit decentralized, almost ‘competing’ w/ FB in a way. Big appeal to IG users is it doesn’t feel like FB so product shift would be the fear if u lose that ’standalone’ ethos
